newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway shares up with Wall Street, but trade thin.
newsitem.headline: Norway shares up with Wall Street, but trade thin.

text.p: Norwegian shares were given a boost on Monday by Wall Street's gains last Friday, but volume was thin partly because of a public holiday in London, dealers said.
Oslo's Total share index rose 1.13 percent to 1,101.86 points in lacklustre turnover of 700 million crowns.
Industrial giant Norsk Hydro, which has a 20 percent weighting on the Total index, was up 1.03 percent at 344 crowns.
Bergesen, Norway's biggest shipping company, also shone, its A share rising 4.38 percent to 155 crowns.

Branded-goods conglomerate Orkla saw its A share up 1.99 percent at 615 crowns following news that the European Commission would examine a planned Nordic alliance between its competitors Carlsberg of Denmark and Coca Cola.
A-class shares in industrial holding company Aker RGI were down 0.6 percent at 169 crowns the day before the release of the group's first-quarter results.
Pharmaceutical company Nycomed was up 1.36 percent at 112 crowns the day before its first-quarter presentation.
